result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel A Hagen

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:03 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Nathaniel A Hagen in court.  Attorney Craig Mastantuono in court for Nathaniel A Hagen.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Will is requesting a new plea and sentencing hearing at the end of November and outlines her reasons why.  Atty. Mastantuono has no objection to the State's request.  Court notes there is an amended complaint and inquires if that should be addressed today or held over for plea and sentencing.  State has no objection to the court addressing the amended complaint today.  Atty. Mastantuono has no objection to addressing the amended complaint today, acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters initial not guilty plea to the amended count 2.  Court will adjourn for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:54 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Nathaniel A Hagen in court.  Attorney Craig Mastantuono in court for Nathaniel A Hagen.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes it confirmed with the Court that victim rights have been complied with so the matter could be called early today.  Atty. Mastantuono provides an update; he was waiting on a decision from the State with respect to an un-filed case before proceeding today.  Atty. Mastantuono requests a new plea and sentencing date as soon as possible.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:45 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Nathaniel A Hagen in court.  Attorney Craig Mastantuono in court for Nathaniel A Hagen.  Atty. Mastantuono provides an update, he is ready to resolve the matter and is asking for a plea and sentencing date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:25 AM Defendant Nathaniel A Hagen in court with Attorney Leah Thomas for Attorney Craig Mastantuono.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Nathaniel A Hagen
Current: 4513 Jay Drive, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: W243 N6560 Oxford Dr, Sussex, WI

Atty. Mastantuono filed a request for an adjournment for 8/4 Initial appearance. Sent to CC Herring for review. 8/02: Atty. Mastantuono called, will make this thursday work. No need to reschedule. Court's response on 8/03 - Denied due to Victim Notification issues (Marsy's law)
